meanings.definition: To insert or place within something else
meanings.sent1: She insetted the key into the lock.
meanings.sent2: The artist insetted a small gemstone into the necklace.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel insetted acorns into the holes of the tree for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: His words were like carefully insetted jewels in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were perfectly insetted together to form a complete picture.

meanings.definition: To add or include as an extra or supplementary part
meanings.sent1: He insetted a new paragraph into the essay.
meanings.sent2: The chef insetted a pinch of salt into the soup.
meanings.sent3: The students insetted jokes into their presentation to make it more engaging.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an insetted melody in the room.
meanings.sent5: The extra details insetted in the story made it more interesting to read.
